references.reason: This paper introduces ShapeNet, a large-scale dataset of 3D models that is heavily used in the visual program induction community and is the source of training data for several experiments in this paper.

references.paper_title: Plad: Learning to infer shape programs with pseudo-labels and approximate distributions
references.reason: This paper introduces the PLAD framework for self-supervised visual program induction which the current work extends by integrating an edit network.

references.paper_title: Write, execute, assess: Program synthesis with a repl
references.reason: This paper introduces a framework for program synthesis using a REPL that is similar to the approach in the current work.

references.paper_title: CSGNet: Neural Shape Parser for Constructive Solid Geometry
references.reason: This paper introduces the CSGNet model, a neural network for parsing Constructive Solid Geometry (CSG) which is a visual programming domain used for experiments in this work.

references.paper_title: Learning to Infer and Execute 3D Shape Programs
references.reason: This paper introduces an approach to learning 3D shape programs that is closely related to the current work.
